timeline.message:
Enhance assertion messages

Previously a failure message like

```
java.lang.AssertionError:

Expecting:
 <0.0>
to be greater than:
 <0.0>
```

would not be easy to interpret.

timeline.bodyText: Is that assertion still useful then? It probably mean to assert that the value gets updated
timeline.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText:
I was hesitant whether to remove it or not. I kept it mostly as a pointer to impossibility to test this properly today, so that someon doesn't re-add it in the future without thinking.
thoughts?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: For DF we removed assertions and added comment in code that points to issue on github, see io.prestosql.plugin.hive.TestHiveDynamicPartitionPruning#testJoinWithSelectiveBuildSide
replies.author: sopel39

timeline.message:
Remove overly strict assertion in TestTableFinishOperator

Operation timing is based on `System.nanoTime()` and
`THREAD_MX_BEAN.getCurrentThreadCpuTime()` and there is no guarantee the
measured elapsed time is positive.
